Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Johnny \John"ny\, n.; pl. {Johnnies}. 1. A familiar diminutive of {John}. [1913 Webster]
2. (Zo["o]l.) A sculpin. [Local cant] [1913 Webster]
{Johny Crapaud}, a jocose designation of a Frenchman, or of the French people, collectively. [1913 Webster]

Johnny n : `johnny' was applied as a nickname for Confederate soldiers by the Federal soldiers in the American Civil War; `grayback' derived from their gray Confederate uniforms [syn: {Rebel}, {Reb}, {Johnny Reb}, {grayback}]
